topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Preparing the Network for Installation

body.p: Before installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, you are responsible for preparing the network for all installations.

section.title: Add Bridge/VLANs on the seed cloud host

li.p: Check the vswitch status using ovs-vsctl show command. If you already have br-data and br-ctl in the seed cloud host, delete them with the below commands:

codeblock.codeph:
ovs-vsctl del-br br-data ovs-vsctl del-br br-ctl ovs-vsctl del-br br-kvm
virsh net-destroy br-ctl virsh net-destroy br-data virsh net-destroy br-kvm

li.p: Create 2 bridges: one exclusive for data to carry TUL traffic and other for non-data traffic like PXE, CTL, CLM, CAN, DCM and so forth:

codeblock.codeph: ovs-vsctl add-br br-ctl ovs-vsctl add-br br-data ovs-vsctl add-br br-kvm

li.p: Run these commands to define the network, start VLANs.

codeblock.codeph:
virsh net-define cghelion-br-ctl-network.xml virsh net-start br-ctl virsh net-autostart br-ctl
virsh net-define cghelion-br-data-network.xml virsh net-start br-data virsh net-autostart br-data
virsh net-define cghelion-br-kvm-network.xml virsh net-start br-kvm virsh net-autostart br-kvm

li.p: Check the vswitch status using ovs-vsctl show command.
To delete any bridge use the following commands.

virsh net-undefine
virsh net-destroy
ovs-vsctl del-br

virsh net-undefine
virsh net-destroy br-ctl ovs-vsctl del-br br-ctl

section.title: Configure Pair Bonding for the KVM Host
section.p: If you have multiple NICs, you can aggregate the multiple interfaces into a single logical bonded interface

For example, if you run ifconfig on your KVM host and you see em1/em2 or eth1/ethx interfaces, you create a bonded interface on the KVM host. If you do not want bond the interfaces, make sure emx or ethx is in the interfaces files.
To create a bond on the KVM host :

li.p: From Console (ILO) use the ifdown command to de-configure the current active ports assigned eth0, em1, or p3p1, as needed
ifdown eth0 ifdown em1 ifdown p3p1
Modifiy the /etc/network/interfaces file to the following (DHCP EXAMPLE):

codeblock.codeph:
# The loopback network interface auto lo iface lo inet loopback
#BR-CTL BRIDGE - UNTAGGED PXE NETWORK CIDR auto br-ctl allow-ovs br-ctl iface br-ctl inet static address 10.200.73.11 netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 10.200.73.1 ovs_type OVSBridge ovs_ports em1
#Bring up interface online allow-br-ctl em1 iface em1 inet manual ovs_bridge br-ctl ovs_type OVSPort

li.p: Reboot the system using the following command:
Execute the ifconfig -a command to output OVS bridge details. If the bridge is not present, execute the following commands to restart the bridge:
Enable the br-ctl network that is used for associating with HLM VM
a. Create br-ctl.xml file like below. Ensure respective VLAN ID for CLM is used.

codeblock.codeph: virsh net-define br-ctl.xml virsh net-start br-ctl virsh net-autostart br-ctl virsh net-list should display default and br-ctl

li.p: c. Display information on the bridge:
The output should appear similar to the following example:

codeblock.codeph: Bridge br-ctl Port "em1" Interface "em1" Port br-ctl Interface br-ctl type: internal ovs_version: "2.0.2"

li.p: Make sure that you can connect to an external NTP server and check that you can connect to an external network after exporting the proxy.
